IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ENLIST TALENT TO ACCELERATE SOCIAL INNOVATION IN BALTIMORE AND ADVANCE A CITYWIDE AGENDA FOR EQUITY AND RACIAL JUSTICE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ENLIST TALENT TO ACCELERATE SOCIAL INNOVATION IN BALTIMORE AND ADVANCE A CITYWIDE AGENDA FOR EQUITY AND RACIAL JUSTICE.
IRS990.Desc: FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM - PLACE TALENTED CANDIDATES IN ONE-YEAR WORK POSITIONS WITH NONPROFITS AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONTRACT PLACEMENTS - BALTIMORE CORPS RECRUITS AND IDENTIFIES TALENT TO FILL NECESSARY ROLES IN VARIOUS CITY AGENCIES. AS A PART OFF THE HIRING STRUCTURE, BALTIMORE CORPS LEADS THE ONBOARDING OF THE NEW HIRE TO OUR HIRING PARTNER. THE HIRING PARTNER WAS FORMERLY FUSION PARTNERSHIPS AND IS NOW BALTIMORE CORPS SUBSIDIARY, EQUITY TALENT SOLUTIONS, LLC

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PUBLIC ALLIES - SIMILAR TO FELLOWSHIP, FOCUSED ON APPRENTICESHIP ROLES FOR AGES 18-24.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CORPS PERFORMED AN EVALUATION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2022, AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO MATTERS THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OR WHICH MAY HAVE ANY EFFECT ON ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. AS OF JUNE 30, 2022, THE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS FOR FISCAL YEARS 2020 THROUGH 2022 REMAINS OPEN WITH THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTION OR THE VARIOUS STATES AND LOCAL JURISDICTIONS IN WHICH THE CORPS FILES TAX RETURNS. IT IS THE CORPS' POLICY TO RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND/OR PENALTIES RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, IF ANY, IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: PARK HEIGHTS COMMUNITY HEALTH ALLIANCE INC

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE BOARD COMMITTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CFO COMPLETES THE DRAFT 990 WITH BALTIMORE CORPS' ACCOUNTANT AND AN OUTSIDE FIRM. THE CEO REVIEWS, THEN PROVIDES THE DRAFT TO THE BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL STAFF AND BOARD MEMBERS SUBMIT CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORMS REGULARLY. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE REVIEWED BY STAFF LEADERSHIP AND/OR THE BOARD. IF A CONFLICT IS FOUND, APPROPRIATE ACTION IS TAKEN BASED ON THE CIRCUMSTANCES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD SETS THE CEO'S COMPENSATION BASED ON JOB PERFORMANCE AND LOCAL MARKET COMPARISONS. THE BOARD SETS OFFICER AND KEY EMPLOYEE SALARIES IN THE SAME MANNER, WITH INPUT FROM THE CEO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CONSULTANT & CONTRACTUAL SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 1,131,867. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 389,111. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 1,875. TOTAL EXPENSES 1,522,853.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
